Package com.lambdaschool.crudyrestaurants.controllers

Class RestaurantController

java.lang.Object
com.lambdaschool.crudyrestaurants.controllers.RestaurantController
@RestController
@RequestMapping("/restaurants")
public class RestaurantController
extends java.lang.Object
The entry point for clients to access restaurant data.

  • Method Details

    • listAllRestaurants

      @GetMapping(value="/restaurants", produces="application/json") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> listAllRestaurants()
      Returns a list of all restaurants.
      Example: http://localhost:2019/restaurants/restaurants.
      Returns:
      JSON list of all restaurants with a status of OK.
      See Also:
      RestaurantServices.findAllRestaurants().

    • getRestaurantById

      @GetMapping(value="/restaurant/{restaurantId}", produces="application/json") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getRestaurantById​(@PathVariable java.lang.Long restaurantId)
      Returns a single restaurant based off a restaurant id number.
      Example: http://localhost:2019/restaurants/restaurant/3.
      Parameters:
      restaurantId - The primary key number of the restaurant you seek.
      Returns:
      JSON of the restaurant you seek with a status of OK.
      See Also:
      RestaurantServices.findRestaurantById(long).

    • getRestaurantByName

      @GetMapping(value="/restaurant/name/{name}", produces="application/json") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getRestaurantByName​(@PathVariable java.lang.String name)
      Returns a single restaurant based off of a restaurant's name.
      Example: http://localhost:2019/restaurants/restaurant/name/Supreme%20Eats.
      Parameters:
      name - The complete name of the restaurant you seek.
      Returns:
      JSON of the restaurant you seek with a status of OK.
      See Also:
      RestaurantServices.findRestaurantByName(String).

    • findRestaurantByState

      @GetMapping(value="/restaurant/state/{findstate}", produces="application/json") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> findRestaurantByState​(@PathVariable java.lang.String findstate)
      Returns a list of restaurants that reside in the given state.
      Example: http://localhost:2019/restaurants/restaurant/state/st.
      Parameters:
      findstate - The two character abbreviation of the state where you want to local restaurants.
      Returns:
      JSON list of the restaurants found in the specified state with a status of OK.
      See Also:
      RestaurantServices.findByState(String).

    • findRestaurantByNameLike

      @GetMapping(value="/restaurant/likename/{restname}", produces="application/json") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> findRestaurantByNameLike​(@PathVariable java.lang.String restname)
      Returns a list of restaurants whose name contains the given substring.
      Example: http://localhost:2019/restaurants/restaurant/likename/eat.
      Parameters:
      restname - The substring in the restaurants' names that you seek.
      Returns:
      JSON list of the restaurants found with the given substring in their name with a status of OK.
      See Also:
      RestaurantServices.findByNameLike(String).

    • findRestaurantByDishLike

      @GetMapping(value="/restaurant/likedish/{dishname}", produces="application/json") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> findRestaurantByDishLike​(@PathVariable java.lang.String dishname)
      Returns a list of restaurants whose menu contains the given dish
      Example: http://localhost:2019/restaurants/restaurant/likedish/cake.
      Parameters:
      dishname - The substring in the restaurants' menu dish that you seek.
      Returns:
      JSON list of the restaurants found with the given substring in their list of menu items with a status of OK.
      See Also:
      RestaurantServices.findByDish(String)

    • getMenuCounts

      @GetMapping(value="/menucounts", produces="application/json") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getMenuCounts()
      Returns a list of all restaurants with their menu counts
      Example: http://localhost:2019/restaurants/menucounts.
      Returns:
      JSON list of all restaurants with their menu counts with a status of OK.
      See Also:
      () RestaurantServices.getMenuCounts().
